scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle.
scenes.description: [Monica] frowns slightly, 'I get that, [Alex], but what if this becomes a regular expectation? It's not fair to you.'

options.text: I believe in supporting the team when needed, but I’ll make sure to set boundaries in the future.
options.analysis: You show empathy and willingness to help, maintaining good emotional perception and social skills while balancing personal time.

options.text: I see your point, Monica. Maybe I should've communicated my limits better.
options.analysis: You offer assistance while setting boundaries, showing good self-regulation but moderate motivation.

options.text: Honestly, if I'm needed this often, maybe the team needs to learn to cope without me.
options.analysis: You prioritize your time off, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
